event.location: Fire ignited in two places in building
event.summary: 3/29/1993: Richard Thomas Andrews firebombed the Blue Mountain Clinic in Missoula, Montana, United States. There were no casualties, but the abortion clinic was destroyed resulting in $100,000 in damages.
event.motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Montana.
event.addnotes: The incident took place during the early morning hours. The clinic was previously the target of many protest. Two years later, the new Blue Mountain Clinic was opened.
event.scite1: "Arson Destroys Montana Abortion Clinic," Associated Press, March 29, 1993.
event.scite2: Adam Clymer, "Reno Urges Senate to Curb Anti-Abortion Violence," New York Times, May 13, 1993.
event.scite3: "Sentence Imposed in Abortion Arson," United Press International, April 28, 1998.
